Instruction: Bring a large pot of water to boil over medium-high heat. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Whisk eggs in a large bowl, then stir in the butter, oil, flour, salt, pepper, and baking powder in separate bowls.

Make an indentation in the middle of the flour mixture and pour in the egg mixture. Combine until a dough forms. Transfer the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead briefly. Divide the dough into 12 equal portions. Shape each portion into an 8-inch long cylinder, then shape into a ring by joining the ends together. Score the outer edge of each ring using a sharp knife.
Boil rings in water two at a time for 1 minute. Remove from water and transfer to lightly greased cookie sheets.
Bake until golden brown, about 20 minutes in a preheated oven.
